faq.answer: Most East Longmeadow residential systems require approximately 3,000-4,000 square feet of unshaded land for a typical 10kW installation. This is about the size of a large backyard. During our free site assessment, we'll evaluate your East Longmeadow property and recommend the optimal system size and placement.

faq.question: Are ground-mount systems worth the investment in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: Yes! While ground-mount systems cost 10-15% more initially, they typically produce 10-25% more energy than rooftop systems due to optimal positioning and better cooling. For East Longmeadow properties with roof challenges or those wanting maximum production, ground-mount systems offer superior long-term value.

faq.question: What permits are required in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: East Longmeadow ground-mount installations require building permits from the Town Building Department and electrical permits. faq.answer: After permit approval, most residential ground-mount installations in East Longmeadow take 3-5 days to complete. The permitting process typically requires 4-8 weeks. We provide a complete timeline during consultation and keep you informed throughout your project.

faq.question: Do ground-mount systems work in East Longmeadow winters?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Our systems are engineered for New England weather, including East Longmeadow's snow and ice conditions. The elevated panel design allows snow to slide off easily, and ground-level access makes snow removal simple when needed. Ground-mount systems often outperform rooftop installations in winter.
